statements: UPDATE leadership_surveys SET leadership_rating = 4 WHERE survey_id = 1;
UPDATE leadership_surveys SET feedback = 'Good job!' WHERE employee_name = 'Alice' AND department = 'HR';
UPDATE leadership_surveys SET department = 'Marketing', leadership_rating = 4, feedback = 'Good work' WHERE survey_id = 1;
UPDATE leadership_surveys SET department = 'Finance', feedback = 'Needs improvement', leadership_rating = 3, employee_name = 'Alice' WHERE survey_id = 3;
UPDATE leadership_surveys SET answer = 'Agree' WHERE user_id = 101 AND survey_id = 1
UPDATE feedback SET comment = 'Good job!' WHERE feedback_id = 10
UPDATE leadership_surveys SET question = 'How can we improve team collaboration?', answer = 'By encouraging open communication' WHERE user_id = 123 AND survey_id = 456;
UPDATE feedback SET rating = 5, comment = 'Excellent feedback' WHERE feedback_id = 789 AND user_id = 987;
UPDATE Leadership_Surveys SET question1='How effective is the leadership team?' WHERE survey_id=1
UPDATE Participants SET department='HR' WHERE participant_id=3
UPDATE Leadership_Surveys SET question1 = 'How do you define leadership?', question2 = 'What leadership qualities do you admire?' WHERE survey_id = 1;
UPDATE Feedback SET rating = 4, feedback_text = 'Great experience, would recommend' WHERE feedback_id = 2;
UPDATE leadership_surveys SET leader_name = 'John Doe', employee_name = 'Jane Smith' WHERE survey_id = 1;
UPDATE survey_scores SET overall_score = 80, leadership_score = 75, communication_score = 85, teamwork_score = 90 WHERE survey_id = 2;
UPDATE leadership_surveys SET leader_name='John Doe', employee_name='Alice Smith', survey_question='How would you rate the leadership skills?', survey_response='Excellent' WHERE survey_id=1;
UPDATE feedback_comments SET comment='Great job on the survey!', submitted_by='Jane Doe' WHERE feedback_id=1;
